borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal">The proposed development fails to deliver the
required minimum Gross Internal Area, bedroom size standards, or built-in storage standard. Additionally, the proposal presents an inappropriate external amenity arrangement. As such, the proposed development introduces sub-standard
accommodation that will not facilitate an acceptable living standard for future
occupiers, and represents a reduced standard of residential accommodation than the existing dwelling. The proposed development is
therefore contrary to:</p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p></o:p></p><p>

</p><p class="MsoNormal">- National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC , 2021); -
Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policies CP3 and CC1 of
the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough
Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2, SP2 and DMD1
of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021);
-DCLG Technical Housing Standards (nationally described space standard) (DCLG,
March 2015) (as amended)<o:p></o:p></p>

<p>The proposed development for x2 self contained flats will result in the loss of a 5-bedroom larger family dwellinghouse which is the type of housing in high demand within the Borough and which policies seek to protect. The negative impact&nbsp;of the proposal regarding the loss of this type of housing outweighs any significant benefit. As such, having regard to the presumption in favour of sustainable development, on balance the principle of development is considered unacceptable and contrary to:-</p><p>National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)</p><p>Policies GG4, H1, H2 and H9 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies CM1, CM2 and CC1 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)</p><p>Policy BC4 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)</p><p>Policies SPDG1, SP3 and DMH4&nbsp; of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;(Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p><p>Housing Supplementary Planning Guidance (GLA, March 2016, Updated August 2017)</p><p>London Borough of Barking and Dagenham Housing Delivery Test Action Plan 2020</p>

<p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;">The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately depict
the&nbsp;proposed development.&nbsp;Specifically the proposed floor plans and elevations&nbsp;indicate mismatching features with regards to a rear door/window and ladder to the upper floor flat. Officers have been unable to accurately assess the quality of accommodation with regards to external amenity.&nbsp;<span style="text-align: justify;">The proposal could
prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the
application; the proposed development cannot be accurately assessed and it
cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan. As
such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p>

</p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy
Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March
2021); - Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy
(July 2010);&nbsp;- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development
Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011);&nbsp;- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning
Document (February 2012);&nbsp;- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London
Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission
Version, December 2021)<span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension to facilitate the conversion of the property into two self-contained units

constraints_details.result: 229 Westrow Drive, Barking, Barking And Dagenham, IG11 9BS
